channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Explore Sarasota area’s September arts scene
item.description: No matter what the weather is like outside, the arts scene in Sarasota, Manatee and Charlotte counties in September is like the calm before the storm of much busier calendars. But the lighter schedule allows you time to explore new shows, plays, exhibitions and concerts indoors and outdoors in the region.

item.title: Sarasota Music Festival director leaving after nine years
item.description: After 61 years as one of the more prominent summer chamber music training programs, theSarasota Music Festivalis heading into transition period with some significant changes coming.

item.title: Who are the Sarasota, Manatee cross country runners to watch this season?
item.description: A freshman from Riverview High earned the spotlight as the area’s most dominant cross country runner in 2024. Madison Muller was the area’s top finisher as runner-up at the FHSAA Class 4A State Cross Country Championships at Apalachee Regional Park in Tallahassee.

item.title: Who are the high school girls swimmers to watch this season?
item.description: The Riverview High girls swim team is beginning to rival Thanksgiving when it comes to being reliable in the month of November. Just like the treasured family holiday, that’s the month the Rams annually win the FHSAA Class 4A state championship.

item.title: Who leads The Herald-Tribune Top 8 Volleyball Power Poll after Week 1
item.description: The top spot in local high school volleyball is up for grabs this year.

item.title: Will the city of Venice cut property taxes for the 2025-26 budget?
item.description: VENICE – The Venice City Council indicated a desire to adopt the reduce property tax rate to keep revenues flat when itapproves the 2025-26 fiscal year budget in September.

item.title: Enjoy lull in tropical activity. It's not expected to…
item.description: You can thank Hurricane Erin, partially, for thequiet in the tropicsright now.

item.title: Florida declares war on Sarasota crosswalk art. Let's…
item.description: Local control has long been a cornerstone of American governance – the idea that communities closest to the people should have the greatest say in their daily lives.

item.title: Lido Shores estate joins Sarasota luxury real estate…
item.description: Another home is for sale on Sarasota's luxury real estate market – with a $26 million price tag and over 200 feet of waterfront property.

item.title: Sarasota County commissioner gave campaign surplus to…
item.description: After her election victory in 2024, Sarasota County Commissioner Teresa Mast donated the unspent remainder of her campaign funds — nearly $30,000 — to a nonprofit run by her husband from which the county had pulled funding earlier this year.

item.title: Here's the 2025 team-by-team Sarasota and Manatee high…
item.description: The 2025 high school football season begins with Florida High School Athletic Association Kickoff Classics on Aug. 14. The regular season begins Aug. 21 and runs through Oct. 31 (with the exception of IMG which will play into November) with most teams playing 10 games in 11 weeks.

item.title: Big talk and tiny results: Corcoran's disastrous reign at New CollegeWilliam Rosenberg Guest columnist
item.description: In 2023New College of FloridaPresidentRichard Corcorandemanded a change to the school's mascot.

item.title: School Board picks local educator as new superintendent in district
item.description: The School Board of Manatee County has selected Laurie Breslin as the district’s next superintendent following a 10-week search. Breslin is a Manatee Schools graduate and the mother of a current student. She is expected to step into the role in early September, pending contract approval.

item.title: What is cashless bail? Pres. Trump's executive order tackles cashless bail
item.description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Monday, Aug. 25, to eliminate cashless bail citing public safety concerns and threatening to withhold state and federal funding to local and state governments that offer the bail option.

item.title: 5 Sarasota restaurants opening, 2 closing — plus downtown fave moving
item.description: From afine-dining favorite calling it quitsto adowntown sushi spot preparing for a big move, there’s been no shortage of restaurant news around Sarasota and Manatee counties this past month.
